programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary is forced far out of her comfort zone when the buyers head to Indio, California. Lockers in this desert town hold many treasures, but it remains to be seen who will buy them.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chumlee are offered a Bugs Bunny poster signed by voice artist Mel Blanc, and also consider buying a golf club once owned by Dean Martin.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee shares his experience of running a successful pawn shop with Antwan, and the team values a rare Second World War artefact.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a piece of playground equipment from a 1970s McDonald's and a portable record player.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.sub-title: David Copperfield: Rick Works His Magic
programme.desc: Illusionist David Copperfield calls on the staff to restore two items from his magic museum's collection, so Rick Dale and his team set out to complete the work for a profit.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: With a gruelling winter ahead, Jamie has employed his biggest heavy rescue team yet in preparation - and when a truck carrying a huge amount of lumber crashes, the team is faced with the first big wreck of the season.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: A blind person who can visualise the environment by clicking his tongue and listening to the echo, another who is immune to electricity, and a strong man who can bend hammers.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The discovery of a San Diego girl's badly beaten body in a canyon in 1991, a case that unearthed a shocking truth which no one could believe.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams focus on classic British motors as they strip the most valuable parts off a Rolls-Royce and a Jaguar Sovereign. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets excited over a jar of powdered gold as he believes it is worth a lot of money, and an explosive acid test is poised to reveal all.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer calls in their lawyer to settle a row over a fake receipt, but Les has a trick up his sleeve.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank rummage around a machine shop in search of rare collectibles.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zachary Quinto goes scuba diving, spelunking and mountain climbing through the Mediterranean in search of the site of the fabled city of Atlantis.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: In 2008, the UK's Ministry of Defence released decades' worth of classified UFO files to the public. One month later, UFO hysteria ripped through the country. Here, the team probes some of the largest sightings of alleged UFOs ever recorded over the English Channel, including two eerie bright-yellow flat objects spotted by pilots in 2007.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a piece of playground equipment from a 1970s McDonald's and a portable record player.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.sub-title: David Copperfield: Rick Works His Magic
programme.desc: Illusionist David Copperfield calls on the staff to restore two items from his magic museum's collection, so Rick Dale and his team set out to complete the work for a profit.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer offers the team a gambling set - complete with concealed weapons - while Chumlee questions the value of a Snoop Dogg doll.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee takes over from Antwaun as the shop's security guard, while the team values a drum from the American Civil War and a motorcycle club uniform.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Man in Black Is Back in Black
programme.desc: Dave Hester returns to the auction circuit, Darrell tries to get Brandon into shape, and Jarrod and Brandi's latest purchase leads them on a wild ride.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Mogul's Return
programme.desc: Jarrod goes bidding with a hangover which Brandi fears will hold him back, while Dave will not let a fight with Laura keep him away from an auction.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets excited over a jar of powdered gold as he believes it is worth a lot of money, and an explosive acid test is poised to reveal all.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer calls in their lawyer to settle a row over a fake receipt, but Les has a trick up his sleeve.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four contestants forge a signature blade from a pile of tools with the two survivors charged with crafting two Chinese butterfly swords to become the champion.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.sub-title: Big Brother: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: A look at how the US government secretly monitors American citizens and how its partnership with Facebook allows it to gather data about its people.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: An investigation into an unusual object spotted over Chicago's O'Hare International Airport in 2006, asking whether aliens are watching Earth's aviation industry.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Part two of two. Zachary Quinto continues his quest to prove that the city of Atlantis not only existed, but was a thriving empire.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley challenges Seth to a unique competition in the shop, and should he lose, the one thing he has been trying to keep a secret will be revealed.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les loses his temper when the kids suggest he should sell their failing second store, while Seth decides to put a sneaky plan into action.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell tries to learn more about the mysterious Mogul, Jarrod and Brandi try not to let Dave distract them, and Ivy makes a find that leads to an adventure on the high seas.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon return to a town where they have always enjoyed good luck in the past - but this time, Dave is the one who comes out on top.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Skipper Tyler McLaughlin gambles on taking the Pin Wheel on the 150-mile trip to Georges Bank in search of a good catch. Meanwhile, Kevin Leonowert, captain of the Christina, is tempted to go harpooning.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Tasmanian trucker Ricky Sutcliffe lays his life on the line driving into an inferno, rescuing bulldozer drivers trapped as they cut firebreaks in the blazing Huon Valley..

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie and his crew retrieve a stolen vehicle that crashed 500ft down into a ravine. Plus, after a tough winter, Adam considers leaving the Alberta operation.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Man in Black Is Back in Black
programme.desc: Dave Hester returns to the auction circuit, Darrell tries to get Brandon into shape, and Jarrod and Brandi's latest purchase leads them on a wild ride.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Mogul's Return
programme.desc: Jarrod goes bidding with a hangover which Brandi fears will hold him back, while Dave will not let a fight with Laura keep him away from an auction.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Jeremy Clarkson, John Sessions, Alexander Armstrong and Alan Davies provide imaginative answers to host Stephen Fry's questions on topics including cheating, caravans and cuckoo clocks.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actress and presenter Mel Giedroyc, heavyweight boxer David Haye, actor-musician Martin Kemp and comedian Romesh Ranganathan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed host Rob Brydon's liar of the week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the comedy panel quiz, with questions relating to animals that start with the letter P. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by comedian Phill Jupitus, broadcaster Danny Baker and actress Teri Hatcher, who all try to come up with interesting answers.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Post-apocalyptic comedy starring Will Forte returns for a third season. In the first episode, a group of armed intruders storm the beach in Malibu.

credits.actor: Will Forte returns for a third season

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Todd is feeling low over recent actions, so Tandy tells a few little white lies to try and cheer him up.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: Paul Danan finally gets his day in court with Shaun Williamson after a pantomime-based fallout, while a husband is sick and tired of his miserly wife ruining Christmas.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: James is called to a drunk driver who, in his inebriated state, has crashed his car into a parked vehicle at high speed, but the story takes a twist when his girlfriend arrives.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank pick New York City for the first time and go back to the future at a sprawling computer store packed with a mind-blowing stockpile.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: The fortune-finding show continues in Bentwaters, with the contents of some old army bunkers exciting the bidders, while a vintage box captures Rupert's attention.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: The chance of winning a car at a blind auction in Perth sends the gang into a bidding frenzy. Presented by Sean Kelly.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys are stunned by a house with storefronts frozen in time, containing a bounty of never-sold stock and a secret bootlegging basement.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank discover a huge and rare collection with enough items to fill a museum, but struggle to agree on a price for a set that is essentially priceless.

programme.title: Jay Leno's Garage
programme.desc: Jay meets NASCAR star Joey Logano, and explores autonomous driving in a Tesla.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team takes a look at off-road models and test-drives the Bentley Flying Spur. There is also an attempt to drive a Jeep across a lake, a comparison of petrol and diesel-fuelled BMW 5 series vehicles, and Davina McCall is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team sets out to discover if driving a Lamborghini Murcielago roadster gives drivers the same kick as 12 angry bulls, and whether the Top Gear theme tune can be played with engines. The Ford F150 SVT Lightning pick-up is put through its paces, the world's greatest power sliders hit the track, and Timothy Spall is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Joel builds a home he has never seen before using a crane he hopes he will never see again. Peter and Beat attempt to build the fastest troll on skis.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The team tries to save the police's ailing horse wagons. An officer escapes with his life after a pursuit car is rammed by a stolen 4x4, while the mounted unit keeps the peace at one of the biggest football clashes of the year.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit. The trio are also joined by The Voice mentor Will.i am, who takes the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by radio presenter Sara Cox, comedian Jason Manford, journalist Nick Robinson and actor Harry Shearer, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by comedy actors Warwick Davis and Hugh Dennis, comedian Katherine Ryan and journalist John Simpson, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Jeremy Clarkson, John Sessions, Alexander Armstrong and Alan Davies provide imaginative answers to host Stephen Fry's questions on topics including cheating, caravans and cuckoo clocks.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies are joined by Aisling Bea, Lee Mack, Jason Manford to answer questions on the subject of peril. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Joe Lycett shows no mercy to a camel, and Hugh Dennis gets a sleeping bag challenge.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy show, with Ed Byrne, Sara Pascoe, Ed Gamble and Nathan Caton joining regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines in September 2015, through stand-up spots and improvised games. Chaired by Dara O Briain.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Rich Hall, Sean Lock, Jo Brand and Alan Davies answer questions on catseyes, camels and centurions, with host Stephen Fry awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene finds himself involved in multiple murder plots when the universally unpopular General Von Klinkerhoffen decides to become more involved in controlling the district.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: It is September 1943 and with the airmen having escaped to England and the Italian troops withdrawn from the area, Rene is hoping for a little peace and quiet. However, such expectations are dashed when Yvette announces she is expecting a baby. Festive episode of the comedy from 1991, starring Gorden Kaye and Vicki Michelle.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: Battle Factory
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how weapons are manufactured in military factories, from the smallest bolts through to machine guns and warships. The opening programme examines the Colt C7 Assault Rifle, a bombsuit made from pieces of hard plastic and bulletproof fabric, and a mortar.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: Tim Sutherland makes numerous discoveries as bones from the 1385 Battle of Aljubarrota, in which Portugal defeated the Crown of Castile, are forensically examined.

programme.title: Nazi Wives
programme.desc: Documentary about the most important women in Hitler's life, and the role women played in the Nazi regime.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit the village of Beadnell on the Northumbrian coast, where mysterious fragments of human bone have emerged over recent years. Legend ties the area to local seventh-century Saint Ebbe, and it is widely believed that a 13th-century chapel once stood here. As the diggers set out to investigate possible remains of an earlier structure on the site, they unearth some shocking finds.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Swansea to investigate the history of White Rock, which was one of the first copper-smelting works. As the archaeologists strip turf and shift tons of earth, they reveal the traces of a once-great industry and rediscover the story of the men who worked in it.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's â€˜Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: In blacked-out London, four young women are murdered in similar circumstances to Jack the Ripper's crimes. Plus, the legend of the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How railway engineers have crossed valleys, canyons and waterways, including the Forth Bridge and a viaduct in rural New Zealand.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Swansea to investigate the history of White Rock, which was one of the first copper-smelting works. As the archaeologists strip turf and shift tons of earth, they reveal the traces of a once-great industry and rediscover the story of the men who worked in it.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist investigates whether animals and plants have developed an awareness of mathematics, including bamboos that flower exactly the same around the world. Plus, the story of a German horse named Hans that was declared a mathematical genius, but all was not as it seemed.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines two creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world. The chameleon has an extra-long tongue that helps it catch prey and the giraffe's neck is so long it is easily able to reach the tops of trees for food.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough swims alongside sea otters, discovering he is no match for their natural agility in the water, while in Florida he takes a dip with manatees for the first time and observes their feeding habits. On the coast of California, he encounters the largest mammals on the planet, blue whales, and reveals how they, along with porpoises and dolphins, learned to court, mate and give birth in the water.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: In blacked-out London, four young women are murdered in similar circumstances to Jack the Ripper's crimes. Plus, the legend of the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's â€˜Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How engineers have built railways across mountains, including tunnels through the Swiss Alps and an Australian track that runs up a near-vertical cliff face.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The crew visits Germany to collect a multi-million-pound maintenance machine so large it will need to be loaded onto two trucks. Eric and Chris oversee a diesel-engine exchange.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene finds himself involved in multiple murder plots when the universally unpopular General Von Klinkerhoffen decides to become more involved in controlling the district.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: It is September 1943 and with the airmen having escaped to England and the Italian troops withdrawn from the area, Rene is hoping for a little peace and quiet. However, such expectations are dashed when Yvette announces she is expecting a baby. Festive episode of the comedy from 1991, starring Gorden Kaye and Vicki Michelle.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: A squeak on Granville's bike interferes with his hopes of romance, and Arkwright worries about a mysterious visitor to a house in Atkinson Terrace.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The Lyell Centre has a new boss in the shape of forensic pathologist Thomas Chamberlain, but he is met with a frosty reception from Nikki, Jack and Clarissa, who are still coming to terms with the death of Leo. Meanwhile, detectives are demanding results in two unsolved cases involving a wealthy mother and son murdered in their London home and the disfigured body of a young woman. Starring Richard Lintern, Emilia Fox, David Caves, Kaye Wragg and Hugo Becker.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Legal action against Larry Cotter proves fruitless, so the sisters decide to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: As the wedding day approaches, Evie feels it is time she met her in-laws, but Daniel's response is less than encouraging.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sexual tension between Evie and Lord Montford intensifies during a tour of the Palace of Westminster. Drama, starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The company is sent to New Zealand for a training exercise, where Paddy and Dave take a new recruit under their wing. Guest starring Lena Headey.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy, Dave and Vinny have a romantic reunion with their wives before the day of exercise with live ammunition begins. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Will questions Zubin's handling of Tom's dismissal during an operation, accusing him of back-stabbing, and Donna is surprised by how seriously Lisa takes her new responsibilities. On the anniversary of baby Amanda's death, Mubbs tells Chrissie the identity of the father, while Diane reveals to Owen that she has been raped in the past.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. The bomb attack on the summer party leaves Adam hovering on the brink of death, and while Tony valiantly risks his own life to rescue his stricken superior, Lance's reluctance to put himself in danger causes him to question his future in the force. Jack's ex-lover Rachel Heath claims he is the father of her baby son and begs him to help retrieve him from the clutches of a religious fanatic, while Gina wonders how to tell Jonathan just how she feels about him.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sheelagh reacts with disgust when Lance suggests Conor may have been behind the bombing - until a shocking discovery compels her to reassess her relationship with her son. Andrea's return to the station prompts Neil to cast aside all restraint, and eager new CID recruit Gary Best goes missing during an undercover assignment, forcing Ken and Rob to embark on a desperate hunt for him. Jack declares his love for Rachel, and it seems Adam could be heading for a court appearance when he refuses to retract his allegations about Jerome Taylor.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Clyde is determined to leave the country - but he is not leaving without Kofi.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle and Rachel find themselves in trouble when Clyde's plans go badly wrong.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A young boy needs his stomach pumped after swallowing his grandmother's anti-depression pills, and Kate finds herself arbitrating between his warring relatives. Protestors gather outside the hospital to stage a demonstration against Holby Healthcare Trust's investment in an armaments company.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An antique Berber rug spells intrigue for the roguish dealer, leading him into a world of unrequited love and umbrella stands. Meanwhile, Lady Jane splits from her husband after refusing to accompany him to Hong Kong for his new job. Virginia McKenna guest stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: The French police ask Jim to investigate the murder of a Jersey resident in their country. The victim is Jack Moberley, a private eye trailing an eccentric lawyer at the time of his death. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey goes to inform Martina that the family will be holidaying in Rome for the Christmas period.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mrs Slocombe's flat is occupied by squatters - so young Mr Grace allows her to stay in a showcase apartment in the store. Classic comedy, starring Mollie Sugden and Harold Bennett.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean pays an unexpected visit during Lionel's lecture tour - only to be surprised herself. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry wins a competition - but when the prize proves more trouble than it is worth, it spells disaster for him and everyone who helps him try to get rid of it. Mike Grady stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the crime drama, starring Amanda Redman as Superintendent Sandra Pullman, a rising star of the Met who is sidelined after a failed hostage rescue. Put in charge of a new department, she is dismayed to discover the unit is to be manned by a motley crew of old-school former detectives who know little about modern police procedure. However, when they re-examine the case of a man whose conviction for murder 20 years ago has just been overturned, their combined experience and unorthodox methods bring interesting results. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and James Bolam play Redman's veteran team, with Jon Finch, Tim Woodwork and Philip Bretherton.

credits.actor: Amanda Redman as Superintendent Sandra Pullman
a rising star of the Met who is sidelined after a failed hostage rescue

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Brian spends time at home making peace with himself over his dismissal, he agrees to help Esther's friend Margaret find her missing brother Peter, in the interest of keeping his mind active. Peter was the accountant of a man who has gone to prison for the murder of his wife, so Brian visits the convict hoping he will be able to assist. However, his investigation begins to encroach on the Ucos team's efforts to track down a conman who may be connected to several outstanding cases. With Rosalind Ayres and Art Malik.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki is asked to give evidence at the appeal of convicted murderer David Bennetto, and when her testimony leads to his release, she ends up locking horns with DI Rachel Klein, who put the man away six years earlier. It seems the detective is right when another young man is found dead at the scene of the original crime. Has Nikki helped to free a serial killer? Emilia Fox stars, with appearances from Tobias Menzies, Michael Socha and Aaron McCusker.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance
programme.desc: Rob Beckett and Romesh Ranganathan host the annual entertainment extravaganza from the London Palladium, attended by the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge. The show features music from Robbie Williams, Jamie Cullum, Emeli Sande, Lewis Capaldi, the Kanneh Masons and Mabel, as well as this year's Britain's Got Talent winner, Colin Thackery, and comedy from Frank Skinner, Kerry Godliman and Flo & Joan. There are also appearances by the casts of West End shows Groan Ups, Mary Poppins and Come from Away, and dance spectacle from Zurcaroh and Cirque du Soleil.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Exploring the creation of classical guitars and fast tractor mowing machines. Plus, how climbers maintain the blades on wind turbines.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to San Francisco in search of a Chevrolet Stepside pick-up truck free from rust, but the one he finds still needs extensive restoration from Edd China.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini races in the Hershey Hill Climb and sells his Shelby Mustang GT 500 KR convertible at auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini helps a well-known customer trade his 1931 Cadillac for a Model A and the car restorer is impressed by an exceptional collection of classics.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Ron Pitts goes behind the scenes of more moments of destruction, including two sports cars colliding at great speed and a massive explosion at a refinery.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Catastrophic flooding topples a hotel, a passenger falls from a hot-air balloon and dozens of drums filled with chemicals burst into flames. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: The team tries to make up for lost time in a new swamp, but washed out roads and broken equipment force unscheduled delays.

programme.title: Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Action from day one at Emirates Arena in Glasgow.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A method for preventing buildings collapsing during an earthquake, the measures taken to ensure electricity is in constant supply, and how balloons are made.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: The Aristarchus Enigma & Martian Space Station
programme.desc: Test pilot Gordon Cooper prepares to test a radical new landing system in a lakebed when two objects appear. Plus, the mystery of Saturn's hexagonal cloud pattern.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The team members gear up for their first trip onto Snake Island itself, where they will face scorching heat and one of the world's deadliest vipers.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Brothers Peter and Mick Cooke face off in an epic scrapheap challenge to build a monster opal hunting machine. The rookies also resort to dangerous night time hunting.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam are back in Devon in search of new bargains. They meet Rodney at his workshop, full of signs, petrol pumps, vintage British cars and lots of rust! Rodney finds it hard to part with some items, but eventually a deal is struck...

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: In Worcestershire, bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove meet a farmer with a shed full of bikes that don't appeal to the guys. However, there's a surprise waiting in a nearby field.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rare, rust-free model of a Datsun 240Z California and Edd China swaps the auto for manual transmission, before the pair try to make a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys a run-down Porsche 928, which leaves Edd China doubtful about their chances of getting the car back on the road again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer meets the proud owner of a Porsche 928 which is in good condition, while Edd China adds the finishing touches to the restoration project.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini restores an AC Ace for a man who has bought it as a surprise for his father.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Sales supremo Mike Brewer has always wanted to have an old Caterham in the workshop, but mechanic Edd China decides to take a risk by painting it a shocking colour.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day two of the ranking tournament at Emirates Arena in Glasgow, where the first-round matches continue.

programme.title: Autobahn
programme.desc: The lives of those people associated with Bundesautobahn 2 in Germany, one of Europe's busiest, most dangerous and most important highways. For many, it's their place of work, and many more use it to travel across Europe.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to San Francisco in search of a Chevrolet Stepside pick-up truck free from rust, but the one he finds still needs extensive restoration from Edd China.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: With the end of the season fast approaching, the rookies risk cave-ins at their abandoned mine claim. Deep underground, Bomb King George is trapped in the blast zone.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a dealer specialising in house clearances, and in Sheffield spots industrial furniture at a 19th-century factory. Later, he finds old punk collectable.

programme.title: Aircrash Confidential
programme.desc: The causes of mid-air collisions, including a 2002 crash in Germany that saw 47 children die and led a grieving father to murder the air traffic controller he thought to be responsible.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Kevin poses as an interviewer to gain access to a Westwind jet, Ken and Danny valet a car to get the keys to a Cessna CJ3, and Mike repos an air ambulance.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of lifeboats that can hold 150 people, and an insight into the manufacture of celebratory stamps.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of tequila from cactus plants in Mexico, and how steam helps to power New York City.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Andrew Cameron, James Cameron & Alexander Dewar: The Revenge Attack
programme.desc: In 2009, the sleepy Norfolk village of Fakenham was hit with the horrific and brutal murder of 45-year-old Steven Murphy. Andrew Cameron and his friend Alexander Dewar denied the act, but were convicted by a jury at Norwich Crown Court.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A look at how a flight data recorder or 'black box' is often the only means of telling how an aeroplane crashed. However, the device sometimes generates more questions than answers.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 15-year-old Elizabeth Ennen, who was last seen when a friend dropped her home. Police uncovered a piece of CCTV that turned the case in an unexpected direction.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Patricia Kimmi, who disappeared from her home in Horton, Kansas, in November 2009. Roger Hollister, an acquaintance of the victim's husband, was later convicted of murder after his wife led detectives to a piece of land where skeletal human remains were unearthed and confirmed to be Kimmi's.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The 1996 investigation into the abduction of a 17-year-old from a shop near his home and the subsequent $30,000 ransom demands.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Emergency animal medical technicians come to the rescue of 17 emaciated pigs.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Terrier Benji is suffering from a heart murmur that could be fatal without immediate surgery. Dr Chris Brown entrusts the dog's operation to Dr Andrew Marchevsky.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Caitie and her wedding planner father clash over a gown, while Danielle lost her mother to cancer, so her dad steps in to help her make the big decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kristy has lost seven stone and is looking for the right dress to show off her new figure, while Kristin, who has shed almost three stone, is excited to fit into dress samples.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Jenee has every detail set for her big day - except for the dress. Country girl, Jessica has a specific vision in mind for her gown, though her sister-in-law's city taste could stand in the way. At her fitting, Leslie is still looking for her mother's approval.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is called upon to treat a policeman's poisoned pet, a malnourished penguin that has been washed ashore and a puppy with a damaged leg.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is called to treat a 12-year-old cat that has been dumped in the surf on Bondi Beach, and tries to help a parrot suffering from depression.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Vet Rachel Lee is determined to save an injured dog that has a deep wound on its neck.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: An investigation into America's puppy mills - large-scale commercial breeding kennels that frequently offer a low standard of care.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades rummage through the homes of impressionist Jon Culshaw and comedian Mark Dolan, in the hunt for items they can upcycle to raise money for charity.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How splinters of bone helped forensic investigators to trace a murderer four years after the victim first disappeared.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of lawyer Royal 'Scoop' Daniel, who vanished in 1997. It later became apparent the Colorado attorney had travelled to Mexico to evade charges of theft and commercial bribery, and it took almost five years to have him returned to America to face justice.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The investigation into 31-year-old Billy Smolinski's disappearance in 2004, which followed the discovery that girlfriend Madeleine Gleason had cheated on him. In 2012, Gleason sued Smolinski's mother and sister claiming they harassed, defamed and falsely accused her of involvement. However, police believe Smolinski was killed by someone related to Gleason, a suspect who has since died.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori wonders if she needs to break out her sage to please superstitious brides.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Marie wants to please her mother and brother, but her indecision mixes with their strong opinions, while Jamie leaves her dress decision to the toss of a coin.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country girl Elizabeth admits she is more comfortable with hunting than dress shopping, while Christina's father does not respond well to a photo of his daughter in her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Self-conscious Katie wonders whether her dream dress will fit, while Ivy's fiance insists she try on a gown that is four times her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A would-be-bride tries to find dresses that will fit her voluptuous bridesmaids, while another battles with her sister, who is determined to wear a tiara to the wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride faces a power struggle with her sister over the colour of the bridesmaids' dresses, while another makes big plans for a memorable second trip down the aisle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.sub-title: You Can't Always Get What You Want
programme.desc: A former cheerleader comes shopping with a boisterous entourage, and a customer tries on her dress for the first time since choosing it five months previously.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer looks for a black and white dress, and Joan has to find a gown for a bride who has so far rejected 10 possibilities.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard hunts for valuable items on an old family estate, steps back in time at a 1920s-themed hotel, and uncovers tiny treasures at an antiques wholesaler.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne finds items to revamp at Woking Recycling Centre, enlisting Emma Walker and the Bristol Upholstery Collective with six dining chairs, a table and some discarded metal.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A woman who married a man attracted to overweight women needed to undergo surgery, and now faces making a fresh start in her life.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Pixie McKenna encounters three huge hernias, and Christian Jessen meets Malissa Jones, who, aged 18, became one of the youngest patients in Britain to undergo an operation to fit a gastric band in 2008.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: The stories of a record-breaking married couple and a hopeful vying for the chance to be the world's smallest man.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Officers reveal a sophisticated burglary with estimated losses of Â£8million when they investigate why a bank manager is unable to open his vault.
